definitions.definition: to give something or someone a particular name, especially describing what you think of it, him, or her:
examples: She was dubbed by the newspapers "the Angel of Death".

definitions.definition: to change the sounds and speech on a film or television programme, especially to a different language:
examples: I'd rather watch a movie with subtitles than one dubbed into English.

definitions.definition: a style of music or poetry connected with reggae in which the main part of the tune is removed and various special effects are added
